headline: Rare protest against China's leader before meeting
excerpt: The protest against President Xi came amid strict Covid measures that have also sparked anger online.
author: Tessa Wong & Stephen McDonell

headline: 'Moment of reckoning' for conspiracist Alex Jones
excerpt: The Infowars host faces huge damages - but will it make a difference to online lies?
author: Marianna Spring

headline: Two dead after shooting outside Slovakia LGBT bar
excerpt: Police say the suspect was found dead after the rare gun attack, thought to have been a hate crime.

headline:
VIDEO 3 MINUTES 40 SECONDS
I didn't believe in the death penalty, until now
excerpt: Families of those killed in the Parkland school shooting wrestle with how the gunman should be punished.

headline: 1,600-year-old mosaic found in Syria
excerpt: Officials say the 1,600-year-old panel depicting classical myths is the most complete of its kind.

headline: Russia annexation condemned by UN General Assembly
excerpt: The overwhelming vote saw 143 countries condemn Russia's attempt to annex four regions of Ukraine.

headline: Anger over graphic Bali bombings memorial video
excerpt: Relatives of Australian victims say "traumatic" footage was played at a 20th anniversary ceremony.
author: Tiffanie Turnbull

headline: US and Mexico make deal to ease Venezuela migration
excerpt: Thousands of Venezuelans will be allowed to enter the US by air, with the aim of easing pressure at the border.
author: Will Grant in Mexico & Tiffany Wertheimer in Singapore

headline: Singapore jails OnlyFans model in landmark case
excerpt: Titus Low, 22, is the first person in the conservative nation to be jailed over the adults-only site.
author: Frances Mao

headline: Mexico Congress votes to keep military on streets
excerpt: The vote means that the army looks set to continue carrying out public security duties until 2028.
author: Vanessa Buschschlüter

headline: UK PM under pressure from own MPs to rethink tax cuts
excerpt: Liz Truss has a bruising meeting with Tory MPs - with some warning she may need to rethink tax-cut plans.
author: Ione Wells and Becky Morton

headline: Latvia abused migrants on Belarus border - Amnesty
excerpt: Amnesty International accuses Latvian authorities of violence and even torture against migrants.

headline: Fresh push to return Elgin Marbles to Greece
excerpt: A new body hopes to return the sculptures, but the UK government says the law will not be changed.
author: Katie Razzall
